Directions: In a bowl, combine the flour, bran, sugar, baking powder and salt.  In another bowl, beat egg substitute, milk and oil; stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.  Gently fold in raspberries.

Coat muffin cups with nonstick cooking spray or use paper liners; fill two-thirds full with batter.  Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.
Ingredients: 1 cup fresh or frozen unsweetened raspberries*
